passages.text: Ar the Bow street Police-court, thee men named

Adolphe Weiner, and Daniel Jacoby, have been.
acharged with being concerned with a man (already
convicted) named Dusant, with attempting to

! murder Jules Tabak, a diamond merchant, and steal- ing the of worth of diamonds, Inspector Langrish deposed that from information received he went with other of ecers and arrested the accused on the present charge. Mr. Tabak, a diamond merchant of 5, Belyrave-ftreet, Kusteneroad, deposed that on Mareh 25 h, two men came to hie house, and asked him to show them some diamonds, Two parcels were shown them, While the men were Jooking at the diamonds the prisoner Palmer struck witness two heavy blows on the head.
